page.title: 13Shanklin Hospital
page.content: {Shanklin Hospital}used to be a house then it became a nusing home and then in 1892 it was a hospital. There was a X-ray room .In the X-ray room there was a big machine that took pictures of your body. There is a ladies ward which has five beds. Some ladies have bed baths because they can not get out bed. There are the three wards and eight side rooms. There are twenty seven beds in the whole hospital. There are six doctors and thirty-six nurses working in the hospital. There is a drugs chest upstairs. In the dayroom the people can watch T.V. The people enjoy the view from the day room window. The garden has a lot of trees and bushes. The hospital is a very big place and it has a lovely site in Luccombe Road overlooking the bay.
